gurmukhi: AwTo eI BUp khXo muK qy Bit Bwjq ho kh ju`Du kro ]jb lau rn mY hm jIvq hY qb lau hir qy qumhU n fro ]
transliteration: Ootho Ee Bhoop Kahyo Moukh Te Bhattee Bhaajat Ho Kah Juddh(u)daro|| Jab Lau Ran Mai Ham Jeevat Hai Tab Lau Har(i) Te Toumhoo Nadaro||
translation: All the eight kings said, “O warriors ! do not run away and fight till the last; do not fear Krishna as long as we are alive;

gurmukhi: hmro ieh Awies hY qumko jdubIr ky swmuih jwie lro ]koaU Awhv qy nhI nYku tro iek jUiJ pro iek Dwie Aro ]1196]
transliteration: Hamro Eh Aais Hai Toumko Jadoubeer Ke Saamuh(i) Jaaedaro|| Ko( i)  Aahav Te Nahinaik(u) Daro Ik Joojh(i) Daro Ik Dhaadaro||1196||
translation: “We command you to confront and fight with Krishna, the king of Yadavas; none of you will have the idea of avoiding the war, even slightly; run forward and fight till the last.”1196.

gurmukhi: Pyir iPry Bt AwXuD lY rn mY jdubIr kau Gyir lIXo ]n try Aiq rois Bry ijX mY Aiq Awhv icqR bicqR kIXo ]
transliteration: Pher(i) Phire Bhat Aayudh Lai Ran Mai Jadoubeer Kau Gher(i) Leeyo|| Na Dare At(i) Ros(i) Bhare Jiya Mai At(i) Ros(i) Bhare Jiya Mai At(i) Aahav Chitra Bachitra Keeyo||
translation: Then the warriors taking up their weapons fought in the battle and surrounded Krishna; they did not retrace their steps even for an instant and waged a violent war in great fury;

gurmukhi: As lY brbIr gdw gih kY irp mo dl mwir ibdwir dIXo ]iek bIrn ky kr sIs kty Bt eykn ko dXo Pwr hIXo ]1197]
transliteration: As Lai Barbeer Gadaa Gadh Kai Rip Mo Dal Daar(i) Bidaar(i) Deeyo|| Ik Bderan Ke Kar Sees Kate Bhat Ekan Ko Dyo Phaar Heeyo||1197||
translation: Holding their swords and maces in their hands, they broke the enemy’s army into fragments; somewhere they chopped the heads of the warriors and somewhere they tore their bosoms.1197.

gurmukhi: sRI jdubIr srwsn lY bhu kwit rQI isr BUm igrwey ]AwXuD lY Apny Apny iek kop hir pY puin Dwey ]
transliteration: Srijadoubeer Saraasan Lai Bahu Kaattee Rathisir Bhoom Giraae|| Ooyudh Lai Apne Apne Ik Kop Bhare Har(i) Pai Poun(i) Dhaae||
translation: Krishna taking his bow in his hand, he knocked down many warriors on chariots, but again the enemies, taking up their weapons in their hands,

gurmukhi: qy biRjnwQ krMgih K`g AB`g hny su Gny qh Gwey ]Bwj gey hir qy Air Xo so koaU nih Awhv mY Thrwey ]1198]
transliteration: Te Brijnaath Karanad(i) Khagg Abhagg Hane Su Ghane Tah Ghaae|| Bhaaj Gad Har(i) Te Ar(i) Yo So Ko( i)  Nah(i) Aahav Mai Thahraae||1198||
translation: They fell upon Krishna; Krishna killed them with his sword and in this way those who survived, they could not stay in the battlefield.1198.

gurmukhi: BUpn kI BwjI cmU KweI hir qy mwir ]qbih iPrY niRp ju`D ko AwXuD skl sMBwr ]1199]
transliteration: Bhoopan Kibhaajichamoondkhaaihar(i) Te Daar(i)|| Tabah(i) Phirai Nrip Juddh Ko Aayudh Sakal Sanbhaar||1199||
translation: After a good thrashing by Krishna, all the remaining army of the kings ran away; then holding their weapons the kings collectively marched forward for war.1199.

gurmukhi: kop AXoDnu mY kir kY kir mY sB BUpn SsqR sMBwry ]Awie kY swmuih sXwm hI ky bl kY inj AwXuD ros pHwry ]
transliteration: Kop Ayodhan(u) Mai Kar(i) Kai Kar(i) Mai Sabh Bhoopan Shastra Sanbhdare|| Ooe Kai Saamuh(i) Syam Hike Kai Nij Aayudh Ros Pradhdare||
translation: The kings with great anger held their weapon in their hands in the battlefield and struck their blows furiously, coming in front of Krishna;

gurmukhi: kwnH sMBwr srwsn lY sr S`qRn kwit kY BU pr fwry ]Gwie bcwie kY XO iqn kY bwhuro Air ky isr kwt auqwry ]1200]
transliteration: Kaahn Sanbhaar Saraasan Lai Sar Shattran Kaattee Kai Bhoo Par Ddare|| Ghaae Bachaae Kai You Tin Kai Baahuro Ar(i) Kes Sir Kaat|| Outdare||1200||
translation: Krishna holding his bow intercepted the arrows of the enemies and threw them on the ground; saving himself from the blows of the enemy, Krishna chopped the heads of many of the opponents.1200.

gurmukhi: Ajb isMG ko isr ktXo hir jU SsqR sMBwr ]Afr isMG Gwiel krXo Aiq rn BUm mJwr ]1201]
transliteration: Ajab Singh Ko Sir Katyo Har(i) Joo Shastra Sanbhaar|| Adar Singh Ghaail Daryo At(i) Ran Bhoom Majhaar||1201||
translation: Krishna cut away the head of Ajaib Singh with his weapons and wounded Addar Singh in the battlefield.1201.
